author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Centre is in the process of launching an insurance scheme for the plantation sector, including rubber, which would cover price fluctuations among other perils, with premium shared by the Centre, State governments and beneficiaries.

Mr. Rajani Ranjan Rashmi, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Commerce and Industry, stated this while delivering the inaugural address at the India Rubber Meet 2016 here on Thursday.

“It is the responsibility of the government to provide a conducive environment to enable the Indian rubber industry to realise its full potential. The government is keen in the overall development of the rubber industry value chain starting from rubber growers to consumers of end products,” said Mr. Rashmi.
title: Insurance scheme for rubber sector on the cards
